TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in ORG . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant applied to a bank for a low - interest loan to which he was allegedly entitled under the PERSON on Veterans . His application was refused on the grounds that the implementation of the above law required a ORG 's directive on the matter , which had never been issued .
The applicant challenged the ORG 's failure to issue the directive in question .
On DATE the ORG of GPE declared the ORG 's failure to issue the directive unlawful and required it to do so within DATE .

As submitted by the Government , on DATE the same court examined another claim brought by the applicant against ORG of GPE and ORG of GPE . He sought a low - interest loan to be provided to him by the authorities . The court dismissed his claim having found that the right to a low - interest loan as set out in the PERSON on Veterans was not directly enforceable , and could not be implemented in the absence of a Government directive .

On DATE , after the case was communicated to the Government , the President of ORG ordered supervisory review to be conducted over the judgment of DATE , and it was quashed in view of the allegedly unlawful composition of the court .
